metadata.description: Top substantiated symptom co-occurrence patterns from Reddit analysis
metadata.data_source: 537 Reddit posts from birth control communities

top_patterns.description: People experiencing both headaches and anxiety are 53% likely to also report fatigue
top_patterns.patient_impact: This strong connection suggests that mental symptoms (anxiety) and physical symptoms (headaches) may compound to create overwhelming fatigue. The 5.4x lift indicates this combination is highly predictive.
top_patterns.plain_language: If you have both headaches and anxiety, you're 5 times more likely to experience fatigue than average

top_patterns.description: People reporting suicidal thoughts are 44% likely to also report depression
top_patterns.patient_impact: This pattern highlights the serious mental health risks associated with birth control for some users. The connection between suicidal ideation and depression is clinically significant and warrants immediate medical attention.
top_patterns.plain_language: Suicidal thoughts on birth control are strongly linked with depression - seek help immediately
top_patterns.warning: ⚠️ If experiencing suicidal thoughts, contact a mental health professional or crisis hotline immediately

top_patterns.description: People experiencing both headaches and fatigue are 89% likely to also report anxiety
top_patterns.patient_impact: Nearly 9 in 10 people with this combination experience anxiety. This suggests physical symptoms may trigger or worsen mental health concerns, creating a feedback loop.
top_patterns.plain_language: If you have both headaches and fatigue, there's an 89% chance you'll also experience anxiety

top_patterns.description: People reporting dry skin are 62% likely to also experience acne
top_patterns.patient_impact: This unexpected dermatological connection suggests hormonal changes may affect skin in multiple ways. Dry skin and acne typically have opposite causes, making this finding particularly surprising.
top_patterns.plain_language: Dry skin users are 2.5x more likely to also develop acne - an unusual combination worth discussing with a dermatologist
top_patterns.note: Research gap: Minimal academic study despite patient reports

top_patterns.description: People with both depression and fatigue are 80% likely to also report anxiety
top_patterns.patient_impact: The mental health triad of depression, anxiety, and fatigue appears frequently. This may indicate a systemic hormonal effect on mood regulation rather than isolated symptoms.
top_patterns.plain_language: Depression and fatigue together predict anxiety 80% of the time

additional_notable_patterns.description: 65% confidence, 1.9x lift - Cognitive symptoms strongly linked to anxiety
70% confidence, 2.0x lift - Physical discomfort may trigger mental distress
58% confidence, 1.7x lift - Panic and general anxiety co-occur frequently

interpretation_guide.confidence: The probability that if someone has the first symptom(s), they will also have the second symptom. Higher is stronger.
interpretation_guide.lift: How much more likely this combination is compared to random chance. >1 means positive association, >2 is strong.
interpretation_guide.significance: Confidence × Lift - our composite measure of pattern strength. Higher values are more meaningful.
interpretation_guide.support: Number of people who experienced this exact combination of symptoms
interpretation_guide.plain_language_note: These are statistical associations from patient reports, not clinical causation. Always consult a healthcare provider.

research_recommendations: The Dry skin → Acne pattern deserves clinical investigation
Mental health patterns (depression/anxiety/suicidal) warrant urgent research
Headache-related combinations may indicate vascular effects
Physical-to-mental symptom patterns (e.g., Bloating → Anxiety) suggest psychosomatic connections
